sections.title: Data Type Identification
sections.content:
Primary Type: marketing_performance
Confidence: 0.95
Key Columns: Date, Channel, Spend, Impressions, Clicks, Conversions, Revenue

The dataset contains daily performace metrics across 5 major channels.

sections.title: Executive Summary
sections.content:
## Performance Overview
Marketing efficiency increased significantly in Q4, with **ROAS improving by 22%** year-over-year. While overall spend remained flat, specific reallocation to [video channels](ref:ev_video_01) drove distinct gains in acquisition.

## Critical Shift
A noticeable decline in [paid search effectiveness](ref:ev_search_drop) was observed starting in October, likely due to increased CPCs, which rose by 15% on average.

sections.title: Strategic Recommendations
sections.content:
1. **Shift Budget to Video**: Reallocate 15% of the Search budget to Video/Social channels to capitalize on the lower CPA trend.
2. **Audit Search Keywords**: Conduct a deep-dive audit of non-branded keywords to identify wasted spend.
3. **Focus on Retention**: Churn rates in the 'Mid-Market' segment have ticked up; launch a targeted re-engagement campaign.

sections.title: Channel Performance Trends
sections.content: Time series analysis shows a divergence in October. Video and Social channels show a robust upward trend in conversion volume, while Search flatlines.

sections.title: System Diagnostics
sections.content: {"validation_checks": ["Passed: Date Continuity", "Passed: Value Range"], "warnings": ["Minor: Missing UTM tags in 2% of rows"]}
